intro: Helminthostachys crenata, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, needle-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
